definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: With heating function, and add light to illuminate.
sentences.chinese: 具有加热功能，及可加光照明。

sentences.english: Add additional cracked pepper and the grated cheese.
sentences.chinese: 另外还可加些胡椒粉和磨碎的乳酪。

sentences.english: Screw in the vertical can also increase overall plate shields.
sentences.chinese: 在纵向丝杠上也可加整体铁板防护罩。

sentences.english: As flavorings, they are often added to candies and chocolates.
sentences.chinese: 作为调味品，则可加在糖果或巧克力中。

sentences.english: Taste the mixture and sweeten with a little more sugar, if you wish.
sentences.chinese: 可以试一下味，如果希望口味更甜些可加一些砂糖。

sentences.english: This additive capability also applies to portfolio management practices. Here is an illustration
sentences.chinese: 此可加的能力还应用于项目组合管理实践中。

sentences.english: Large lot with plenty room to add on.
sentences.chinese: 地大有大量的空间可加建。

sentences.english: Various types of weights can be attached to handgrips to add resistance to the exercise program.
sentences.chinese: 各种形式的重量皆可加于手把上以增加阻力。

sentences.english: Extra bed is available if necessary.
Linear equation means that solutions are additive.
sentences.chinese: 线性方程的结果是可加的。

sentences.english: If can be added for low pigment anaemia, use chalybeate.
sentences.chinese: 如为低色素贫血可加用铁剂。

sentences.english: We can use the additive property of the integral.
sentences.chinese: 我们可利用积分的可加性。

sentences.english: Lean meat can be larded to keep it moist in the oven.
sentences.chinese: 瘦肉上可加咸肉片烤制以保持水分。

definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
equivalent to 就可以/can then (do sth)/can immediately (do sth)/(do sth) and that will suffice
to consider/to allow for/to use one's discretion/to measure (food and drink)
to work extra hours/to do overtime
carbonized mugwort leaf (used in TCM)/Folium Artemisiae argyi carbonisatum
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
